---
title: isBrowser
slug: en/v2/api/utils/is-browser
---

The `isBrowser` function determines whether the current JavaScript runtime is a browser environment.

### Import

```ts
import { isBrowser } from "@tai-kun/surrealdb/utils";
```

### Usage

```ts
function isBrowser(): boolean;
```

#### Arguments

None.

#### Return Value

Returns `true` if the environment is a browser, and `false` otherwise.

#### Example

The following example determines whether the environment is a browser:

```ts
import { isBrowser } from "@tai-kun/surrealdb/utils";

if (isBrowser()) {
  document;
}
```

### Explanation

If the global variable `document` is not `undefined`, it is considered a browser. For example, Deno adds the `window` object globally, so checking the presence of the `window` object could incorrectly identify a server runtime as a browser. The web framework Remix calls this the [Document Guard](https://remix.run/docs/en/main/guides/constraints#document-guard).
